p: Finally, nelfinavir mesylate, the mesylate salt of the antiviral drug nelfinavir which has been characterized as a HIV-1 protease inhibitor ( Patick et al., 1996; Markowitz et al., 1998), was found to have antiviral activity against HSV-1 and other herpesviruses and to inhibit the maturation and export of viral particles ( Kalu et al., 2014). As a consequence, nelfinavir mesylate is currently being assessed in a clinical study for the treatment of patients with Kaposiâ€™s sarcoma, as well as its potential effectivity activity against HSV-1 and HSV-2, which is a tertiary goal in this study ( ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT03077451).
